description: Submit early warning without undue delay and in any event within 24 hours of becoming aware of significant incident
Submit incident notification without undue delay and in any event within 72 hours of becoming aware of significant incident with initial assessment severity impact indicators of compromise
Submit final report not later than 1 month after incident notification including detailed description root cause mitigation measures cross-border impact
Provide response without undue delay and where possible within 24 hours of receiving early warning including initial feedback and guidance on mitigation
Member States adopt and publish measures necessary to comply with NIS 2 by 17 October 2024
Member States apply transposed measures from 18 October 2024
Member States submit to Commission by 17 April 2025: number of essential/important entities per sector/subsector
Member States submit annual updates to entity lists
Member States notify national cybersecurity strategies to Commission within 3 months of adoption
Member States assess and update national cybersecurity strategies at least every 5 years

deadline_name: CSIRT Quarterly Summary Report to ENISA
description: Single point of contact submits to ENISA every 3 months summary report with anonymized/aggregated data on incidents threats near misses
Commission reviews application/scope of NIS 2 and submits report to European Parliament/Council by 17 October 2027
